title: iOS update adds to carbon emissions forecasting trend - TechHQ
summary: Apple announced a new feature for iOS16.1 called clean energy charging. When activated, this feature will attempt to charge devices during periods when renewable energy sources are most active. This is part of a larger trend in the tech sector to use carbon emissions forecasting to reduce the environmental impact of digital devices and services.
green_innovation: TRUE, because it reduces negative environmental externalities by promoting the use of renewable energy.
business_innovation: TRUE, because it introduces a new business process that differs significantly from previous processes by integrating carbon emissions forecasting into device charging.
green_product: FALSE, because the innovation relates to a business process rather than a product.
green_process: TRUE, because it introduces a new method for charging devices that minimize environmental impact by prioritizing renewable energy.
likely_naics_codes: ['334413 - Semiconductor and Related Device Manufacturing', '335999 - All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing', '511210 - Software Publishers', '541512 - Computer Systems Design and Related Services']
greenwashing: FALSE, because the innovation is a genuine attempt to reduce environmental impact.

title: Can you future-proof a refinery against climate change concerns? Shell thinks so - CBC.ca
summary: Shell is transforming its Scotford industrial complex into a low-carbon energy production facility by reducing emissions and producing new types of low-carbon products. Despite the industry's record profits last year, only about five per cent of worldwide investment by the oilpatch went to wind, solar and other renewable energies in 2022. Shell invested about $3.5 billion globally on its renewables and energy-solutions business, which includes a variety of technologies from wind and solar farms, to carbon offsets, carbon capture and biofuels.
green_innovation: TRUE, Shell is transforming its Scotford industrial complex into a low-carbon energy production facility by reducing emissions and producing new types of low-carbon products.
business_innovation: TRUE, Shell is investing in carbon capture and storage technology, renewable energy projects, and exploring the production of biofuels, hydrogen, and sustainable aviation fuel.
green_product: FALSE, the article does not describe any specific green products.
green_process: TRUE, Shell is using carbon capture and storage technology to reduce emissions from its hydrogen production facility.
product_or_process: carbon capture and storage technology, renewable energy projects, biofuels, hydrogen, and sustainable aviation fuel

title: Custodians of carbon: creating a circular carbon economy - Frontiers
summary: This article discusses the potential of carbon capture and utilization (CCU) to mitigate climate change. It highlights the need for a holistic approach to sustainability assessment of CCU projects, considering the environmental, economic, and social pillars. The article also emphasizes the importance of considering the full system when evaluating the sustainability of CCU technologies, including the energy source used for CCU and the end use of the captured carbon.
greenwashing: The article does not describe any specific product or process innovations, so it is not possible to determine whether they are examples of greenwashing.

title: Is the Diskless Architecture the Most Preferred for the Cloud and Internet Industries? - Huawei Enterprise
summary: The diskless architecture is gaining popularity in the cloud and internet industries due to its energy efficiency, high performance, and high reliability. Huawei's OceanDisk Smart Disk Enclosure is a product that helps data centers implement the diskless architecture. The diskless architecture is an example of green innovation and business innovation.
green_innovation: TRUE. The diskless architecture reduces energy consumption and waste by decoupling storage and compute resources.
business_innovation: TRUE. The diskless architecture is a new or improved business process that differs significantly from previous business processes and has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: TRUE. The OceanDisk Smart Disk Enclosure is a green product because it is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its lifecycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a green process.
